author: kolbyml
content:
<https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/883>
In this breakout room it was discussed that to have 4’4s strong alternative history access providers would need to be available to be able to do 4’4s. Contingent on that formats for storing historical data and validation of canonical-ness for pre-merge data was stated as being stable where post-merge wasn’t. So the idea was stated that if the Portal Network’s history network was in production and work done for using BitTorrent which uses ERA files was done. We could do pre-merge 4’4s (I assume on testnet) within a rough ballpark of a year. Leaving post-merge 4’4s for later. So doing 4'4s in 2 stages.

This was a middle ground reached by representatives of Geth and Nethermind respectively.

author: kolbyml
content: In the upcoming months and weeks we (EF Portal) plan to hold meetings with all the EL teams regarding their plans for 4’4s and whether the Portal Network is a good match for their proposed use cases, along with also talking about future data we will provide within roughly 1-3 years (my words) which includes beacon light client data, and access to full archival state. We already held a few of these meetings during Devconnect and they were found to be very mutually beneficial.
